definition: the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), namely: all life is suffering 苦, the cause of suffering is desire 集, emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭, the way 道 to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道/also called 四諦|四谛
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
sectarian bias/parochialism

annihilation (of soul, Sanskrit uccheda)

synonym/close equivalent expression
superior judgment/sagacity
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
to write on the blackboard/writing on the blackboard
subtle words with profound meaning (idiom)
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
difficulty/degree of difficulty or ease
